description.narrative: By end 2021, schools, health and CNA centres and villages in the neglected zones within the 10 targeted provinces, as well as those facing endemic diseases (cholera, Guinea worm, etc) and severe malnutrition have quality and equitable drinking water supply systems and sanitation structures

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, schools, health and CNA centres and villages in the neglected zones within the 10 targeted provinces, as well as those facing endemic diseases (cholera, Guinea worm, etc) and severe malnutrition have quality and equitable drinking water supply systems and sanitation structures

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, in 2019, 39,726 new individuals, including 20,658 women, had access to drinking water and 15,567 pupils, including 8,184 girls, benefited from drinking water and sanitation facilities. Ten health centres have improved in terms of access to sanitation services through the construction of institutional latrines and water points. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020
